utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Hello, everyone. I'm Juan Williams, along with Katie Pavlich, Jesse Watters, Dana Perino, and Greg Gutfeld. It is 5:00 in New York City, and this is The Five.

utterances.speaker: SEN. KAMALA HARRIS (D-CA), VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
utterances.utterance: The American people have witnessed what is the greatest failure of any presidential administration in the history of our country.

utterances.speaker: MIKE PENCE, VICE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: Senator Harris, you are entitled to your own opinion, but you are not entitled to your own facts. Are you and Joe Biden going to pack the court?

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.utterance: Let's talk about packing the court then. Let's talk about --

utterances.speaker: PENCE
utterances.utterance: Please. I just want the record to reflect she never answered the question.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The vice presidential candidates slugging it out in Salt Lake City, our reaction in just a moment. But first, the rest of the debate schedule now up in the air. The uncertainty starting this morning when the Debate Commission announced the town hall between President Trump and Joe Biden would be virtual, the president reacting.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: I'm not going to waste my time on a virtual debate. That's not what debating is all about. You sit behind a computer and do a debate. That's ridiculous. It was announced. And they are trying to protect Biden, everybody is.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The head of the RNC slamming the Debate Commission, accusing it of bias.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: And now, they're not following the science. They are saying we're going to go virtual. Biden didn't ask for that. The president didn't ask for that. And I will just tell you. I hope no future nominee of our party works with this Commission. They are a total joke. And they are hurting our democracy and they are impacting this election.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The two campaigns also getting into a contentious back and forth all day long, each accusing the candidates of not wanting to face each other. And now, ABC says Joe Biden will do a town hall on October 15th. That's the day the second debate was originally scheduled to take place. Dana, yeah, I think lots of people are wondering whether or not the president hurt himself today by pulling out of the debate when he is the one that needs to really, you know, redirect the campaign that's in a downward spiral.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: I think that remains to be seen. Let me -- I don't understand the Debate Commission's decision today. So we were in Utah. We were -- Katie and I were together. I'm sorry. You were there, too?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You were there. You were right in front of us. So we were all -- we find out on the drive to the airport that the Commission just sort of like put it out there without any sort of communication strategy around it, which I found really bizarre. It was, like, hey, here is -- in a statement that we're just not going to do this. And then both campaigns said that they weren't consulted. And it was the decision that the CPD made. OK, so it would be good to know how did you come to this decision, why not talk to the candidates beforehand? Why not try to see if we could work something out? Even Joe Biden said, well, could we move it a few days later? Like, he wasn't even trying to say let's try to do it. Now, President Trump says I'm not going to do it. I think that's fine. I think that -- I think it would be fine if he didn't. We have all been doing Zoom calls. It might be weird. You know, it's weird like when the dog barks and things like that. But I think that it would be fine. And now that Joe Biden is going to do this event on the 15th, that means that President Trump is free to go do something else. Like, where might he want to go to do an event on the 15th? And maybe just wait and just have one final debate in Nashville if that one can happen.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Greg is waiving his hand.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: I know what he should do, The Five, one hour town hall with Donald Trump. I don't know why no one has planned or scheduled this. But having us with Trump would be beautiful television. We don't even actually need the town hall. It could be just us five and him would be fantastic. That's what we do October 15th.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wasn't he doing that all the time when he was interrupting our show for those things?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's a good idea, Greg. And I think that we should pursue it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But let me finish up with the question.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So I was going to come to you and say but -- until the president releases his health documents and the doctors say that he is not contagious, what is the rational basis for Joe Biden saying, oh, yeah. I'm going to put my health at risk, or the Commission saying we are going to put our staff and everyone else at risk.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There is a good argument for a virtual debate, although they are not doing it because of the good argument. They are doing it because, in my opinion, Pence crushed it last night, right? And this was a great way to steer that spiral -- that downward spiral of that event. I mean, Kamala was an embarrassment. And so this was a great way to change the topic. So it's kind of natural to be suspicious. But we all have to admit that when we did our remote, there wasn't less interruption. There was more, because you can't have eye contact and be around people. So the idea of having a virtual debate is going to be really hard for -- to improve upon anything. I think what they need to do is figure out how to have these people in a room safely nearby. They are both on the east coast, I imagine. And have a good solid ref. Have somebody that maybe apolitical, a Joe Rogan perhaps, somebody who don't know where is he going to go, but you know it's not going to be two against one -- whether left or right. It's just going to be down the middle. And I think that would be great, but I still think the town -- The Five town hall is the way to go. And I know he is watching.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: By the way, I'm surprised at you, because I think you'll say virtual stuff is the future and everybody can do it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But you've seen how our show worked.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think it was fine.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: You kept interrupting us, Juan --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's why Katie and Dana said I wasn't at the debate --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- need to have space for rebuttal if you are going to do a virtual --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- no space for that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, but there would be space between these two, and I know you're

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right. So Jesse, it is clear from the polling that Biden won the first debate. And by the way, I thought --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I would take issue with that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: There's no issue. It's very clear.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, anyway. Let me just continue. So now, Trump has removed the line of attack that Biden is the one who's afraid of debate, because it's Trump who pulled out of the debate, so again --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think you are reading it wrong, Juan. Greg is right here. This is very underhanded by the Debate Commission. They dropped this bomb at 7:30 in the morning, after Kamala got smoked, without consulting the Trump campaign. They didn't have to do it at 7:30 in the morning. They could have done it this afternoon. They could have done it tomorrow. Trump has a full week to get healthy, get clean, and get tested. They did this to take the attention away from that master class of a debate performance that Mike Pence put on. I didn't want to have to do this, Juan. But when I heard about how underhanded the Commission was, I had to do a deep dive into the Commission.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Please.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Would you like to hear what -- I'm going to put these people on blast. I didn't want to do it, but now I'm forced to. So the executive director, Kate Brown, Democrat donor, and the rest of them basically are either Democrat donors or activists, or Republicans who don't like Trump. And there is a long record, Dick Parsons, Republican. Quote, "Trump is not good for America." John Danforth, Republican, said Trump corrupted the Republican Party. Olympia Snowe, Republican, says Trump has damaged the Republican Party. You want me to keep going? Here are the Democrats --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Let me finish.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I take issue with that. ABC anchor called Trump toxic. Paul Kirk Jr., former DNC chair endorsed Bernie, Dorothy Riding (ph) former DNC official, Kenneth Wollock (ph) Obama donor said Trump was hurting democracy. Shall I go on?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jesse, Jesse, Jesse, it's a mix of Republicans and Democrats.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- the head of the Republican National Committee.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's like saying Mueller is a Republican, even though 13 of his gang were all Democrat Party.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, here's the point.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They dislike Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They are quoted as saying Trump is toxic. He's and dirty and is damaging the country. That's not fair to the president.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Every Republican who doesn't like Trump is now a rhino (ph).

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't think this commission was trying to help Kamala. I don't think that this morning, but I do think --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, then --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- fortune 500 companies.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- the two of you, you agree to the rules that were set by your campaign people. Katie?

utterances.speaker: KATIE PAVLICH, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So the president today called Kamala Harris a monster. It reminded me of when he said Hillary Clinton was a nasty woman. Now, you and I both know suburban women -- suburban white woman, specifically are a audience for this campaign. Didn't he hurt himself again?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I think that question implies that suburban women are a lot more emotional than you think they are. I think that they believe in the economy. They believe in security and safety. And a lot of women believe in the same feminism of being treated the same way that men would be treated. And President Trump has called a lot of men nasty names, too. He said the same thing about Kamala Harris. I don't think that he treats her any differently. He said some things about Hillary Clinton when he was running against her and still won the White House. So I'm not really sure it will have a big impact when you are looking at whether I'm going to have a job in a year, versus whether I want to be upset about someone getting called a mean name in the game of politics. Especially after Joe Biden called President Trump a clown and told him to shut up during the first debate. So there is that issue. But in terms of The Five hosting the president, Mr. President, this seat is the one you can be in. So give the producers a call. They're waiting for you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hey, wait a minute. I will take Katie Pavlich over Trump any day. Coming up, our reaction to all the big moment at last night's debate right here for you on The Five.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: A lot of big moments from last night's first and only vice presidential debate. Mike Pence getting top marks for countering Kamala Harris and exposing the far left Biden agenda.

utterances.speaker: PENCE
utterances.utterance: In America, you just heard Senator Harris tell you. On day one, Joe Biden is going to raise your taxes.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.utterance: The president's trade war with China. He lost that trade war.

utterances.speaker: PENCE
utterances.utterance: Lost the trade war with China? Joe Biden never fought it.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.utterance: He has referred to our men who are serving in our military as suckers and losers.

utterances.speaker: PENCE
utterances.utterance: Slanders against President Donald Trump regarding men and women of our armed forces are absurd.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The candidates also battling over the Coronavirus.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.utterance: The American people have witnessed what is the greatest failure of any presidential administration in the history of our country. They knew and they covered it up.

utterances.speaker: PENCE
utterances.utterance: When you look at the Biden plan, it reads an awful lot like what President Trump and I and our task force has been doing every step of the way. It looks a little bit like plagiarism, which is something Joe Biden knows a little bit about.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, Greg, the debate for Mike Pence, what were your thoughts?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I was pleasantly surprised and I was let down by her behavior. I always expected more from her. It seems like she regressed instead of improved over the last year. But I'm really grateful that Pence finally called out the fine people lie. Because when Kamala brought it up, he went straight for it and took her out. And it's beautiful because nobody is fact-checking it. And BBC actually fact-checked it and they backed Pence up. So Pence has opened the door for other people, and not just me and others, to talk about the transcript and say that this destructive lie, which has been around for three years and responsible for so much racial division, simply isn't true. And I think that was, like -- to me, that was the most important, moving part of the debate it. It meant a lot to me. I also thought it was funny when she was going after him about COVID, about his keep calm and don't panic stance. She brought up toilet paper hoarding.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: His point, which is toilet paper hoarding, was an example of panic, and why you shouldn't do it. And also, undermining the scientists, clearly, she is like a lot of Democrats and thinks that Trump actually makes the vaccine and sells it. No, if the vaccine is there, it goes through FDA. It goes through a process. And she clearly doesn't know that. She should have done her homework.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah. We have that sound. Lets' listen in, then Dana can react to that.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.utterance: If Fauci, if the doctors tell us that we should take it, I will be the first in line to take it, absolutely. But if Donald Trump tells us that I should -- that we should take it, I'm not taking it.

utterances.speaker: PENCE
utterances.utterance: The fact that you continue to undermine public confidence in a vaccine, if the vaccine emerges during the Trump administration, I think is unconscionable. Stop playing politics with people's lives.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That was one of the pretty substantive attacks on what she said, along with some of the other energy politics and the taxes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The vaccine one was pretty interesting, because if they were to win, Biden and Harris, they then would be the recipient of the benefits of Operation Warp Speed.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And then they would be the ones encouraging people to go out and take the very same vaccine that is being worked on now. And hopefully, we do have that soon. I did I think -- there were a couple of issues that have just been missing from any of the debates so far, immigration and gun control, for example. But on energy, I thought Susan Page did a very good job asking Kamala Harris about the Green New Deal. And then they get into discussion about fracking. And she says I want to be very clear, Joe Biden will not ban fracking. What I thought was very interesting is that Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez then tweets, actually, fracking is terrible. And I thought this truce between the far left and the Biden-Harris campaign is a marriage of convenience until they see if they could reach their goal, which is to oust Donald Trump, and then you are going to see Biden and Harris. That administration just pulled in all sorts of directions by the left.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What do Biden-Harris really believe about natural gas? Because we have plenty of tape where they say no fracking, at least three or four instances, and now they say oh, yeah, we will frack. I don't understand what they really believe. Do you?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's so clear. I mean, Biden has laid out his plan, which creates a division between what takes place on public lands and private lands. And he says no fracking on public lands, and he's not going to stop it on private lands. So Jesse, I don't understand.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's the first time I ever heard that --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You should check out. Do a little research. I mean -- but, you know, to me, the big thing here is that the first half hour of that debate was dedicated to a discussion of COVID. And she absolutely mopped the floor with him. And not only did she mop the floor with him, she mopped the floor with Donald Trump. And then you guys say, oh, but he did so well because he got in this nasty little dig about plagiarism because the Biden plan is the same as the president's plan. Well, it's not.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What's different?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's not. Biden wants a national plan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What does that mean?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He wants to have a national plan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What's that mean, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Trump wants to leave that up to the states.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What does a national plan mean?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me finish.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But what does it mean?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He says leave it up to the states. Blame the governors. Blame everybody --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Biden says trust national health officials. Trust the scientists. Guess what Trump says -- what do the scientists say.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And not only that, the vaccine -- the vaccine program. Guess who. You know, you know, Biden says let's have a vaccine program that we can have faith in, because we know the scientists are in charge, not the president's son-in-law. That's a big difference -- a big difference.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Nice try. Katie?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: OK. First of all, I think it's incredible that the Biden-Harris campaign has been able to get away with blaming President Trump for the death toll that Coronavirus has taken on in America, when the vast majority of the numbers come from New York, New Jersey, Democrat-run.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: They are not Americans?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: They are Americans. But the blame in terms of the politics is not being placed on Governor Cuomo, nationally. It's being placed on President Trump when Governor Cuomo is the one who praised him at the beginning for all the things he was providing, the Navy hospital, building up the Javits Center, et cetera. We all were there. We all know what happened. But it is true that Biden has been one step behind what the president has announced. So President Trump enacted the Defense Production Act to get PPE produced in higher quantities here at home, then Biden comes along and was, like, we should do the Defense Production Act. It was invoked two weeks ago. He says that they need a plan for vaccine distribution. Well, the president, a month ago, had a press conference at the White House, saying the military, which is the most efficient supply chain in the world, is going to help supply the vaccine to the people who need it the most. So it's just interesting that the president is being held accountable. And on the China issue, again, Kamala Harris dodged it completely, blaming the president for covering up the virus when it was the World Health Organization and the Chinese Communist Party that was lying about the spread, which is why it turned into a global pandemic. So -- and just one more thing on the issues with the Second Amendment that they haven't brought up. You know, the questions that aren't being asked in these debates benefit Democrats, because the Second Amendment is not a good issue for Democrats at a time when Kamala Harris wants to confiscate firearms. And there are five million new gun owners since the beginning of this year alone. It's the biggest year on record, and a lot of them are in swing states.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We have riots. Gun control is a dead issue for them.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me just say. You were bringing up this stuff about Charlottesville.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Even your friend Scott Adams had to say, you know, I'm so disappointed the --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- and he was very supportive of when Mike Pence finally --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, Scott Adams. You know, tip to Scott Adams.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That makes no sense.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It makes sense when you don't condemn white supremacists.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Read the transcript, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- white supremacy, go for it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, come on, man.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do I need to disavow white supremacy right now?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. Ahead, Kamala Harris getting called out for dodging a key question on the Supreme Court at the debate.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Kamala Harris following Joe Biden's lead in refusing to answer whether Democrats will pack the Supreme Court if they win the election in November. VP Pence quickly calling her out.

utterances.speaker: PENCE
utterances.utterance: They would like to know if you and Joe Biden are going to pack the Supreme Court if you don't get your way in this nomination.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.utterance: Let's talk about packing.

utterances.speaker: PENCE
utterances.utterance: Once again, you gave a non-answer. Joe Biden gave a non-answer.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.utterance: I'm trying to answer you now.

utterances.speaker: PENCE
utterances.utterance: The American people deserve a straight answer.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.utterance: Let's talk about packing the court then.

utterances.speaker: PENCE
utterances.utterance: Please. I just want the record to reflect she never answered the question. Maybe in the next debate, Joe Biden will answer the question.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: PENCE
utterances.utterance: But I think the American people know the answer.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: And Biden refusing to answer the question again on the campaign trail today, saying he will give his opinion on court-packing after the election. So Dana, that's not a no. It's not a no. We are not going to pack the court. It's a maybe, we will.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I thought that Mike Pence prosecuted that case very, very well. I think that her laughter in that instance was a little bit about nerves. It is really unbelievable that at this point they still don't have an answer. But now, because we had Joe Biden saying again today actually I'm going to wait until after the election. Two things on that, one, I think that on an issue that important that the American people are being asked to help decide their fate for the next four years or beyond, that that is an issue that really -- they deserve to have an answer on. I think the fact that they are not answering it means that the answer is yes. I mean, that's what you obviously -- you have to conclude that it's yes. The second thing I want to bring up, though, is I don't think Joe Biden is really actually for packing the court. I don't think he is. But what would happen if he said that he is not? What would happen if he actually took a principled stand and he led on the issue? Would that mean that all the people on the left that are in this marriage of convenience, this tenuous truce decide, you know what, it's not even worth it?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Yeah. They don't want to vote for him any way and they are struggling to do it. Greg, Senator Harris accused the Trump administration of racism for daring to fill judicial nomination seats as her answer to the court-packing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's basically that last club in your golf bag, you know? It's, like if you have got nothing, just pull out the old race club and see if you can get out of the --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The rough?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The rough, thank you. Why was that moment so important? Because it showed you that she didn't look presidential. She didn't even look or sound senatorial. And she is a senator. Like I said, I picked her -- I thought she was going to be the nominee. And I thought she was going to be the VP choice. But man, it's like all this time they didn't prep her? She just seems so light weight. So this is a huge win for Trump. And even though it was Pence, it's a huge win for Trump, because she's not really -- she maybe the number two spot, but they -- Biden is relying on her pretending or becoming the number one spot. She's actually running for number one. And they just showed that she can't be number one, not in this current state.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: But the reason why she's never comfortable, and this is why she wasn't a good presidential candidate is because she doesn't know where she stands on the issues in terms of principle, because she has changed them so many times, Juan. And she's on the record saying she's willing to get rid of the filibuster in order to pack the Supreme Court, but now doesn't want to answer the question.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know, I just find this whole discussion here on THE FIVE so one-sided because it was parents who couldn't say to the most consequential question of the night, will you respect the results of the election? He couldn't just say yes, absolutely. No, he says, well, we see how the election -- I mean, it's crazy.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Should they pack the court? Yes or no?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Should they pack the court? Yes or no?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me just say, if it was up to me -- if it was up to me, here's how I would have answered it. And by the way, I thought she did not do a good job on that question. She won the debate, but she didn't do a good job on that question. I think she should have quickly pivoted and said, Katie, you know, wait a second, let's talk about not only the fact that the judges who've been put on the court are all white men --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Racist.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But let's -- but let's talk about the fact that you're having a rushed process to force a nominee onto the court while Americans are voting on elections taking place for the President.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wait, what about Clarence Thomas?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And let's look at how the Republicans have corrupted this process. And most Americans would have agreed with Kamala Harris that this is absolute brute political politics should and not should be done.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I guess, Clarence --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: In fact, I think it's crazy that Trump prioritizes Barrett over getting relief for our economy that's struggling from Coronavirus.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK, well, Jesse, Judge Amy Coney Barrett is not a white man. So, that argument doesn't stand under who she is.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is Clarence Thomas nominated by Donald Trump?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, you said on the court?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no, no, Donald Trump nominee.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm just trying to correct you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: This is what --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Be accurate, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I'm accurate. This is what she was speaking about last night. That if you look at Donald Trump's nomination to the court --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's only white men. I heard that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's largely white men.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: As the debate moderator, I'm giving the floor to Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Largely white men is not a third woman, so that counts for something, Juan. And before she grabbed the race club, Greg --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She lied about Honest Abe. Now, if you lie about Lincoln, I think that just disqualifies you for running for the V.P. This is what she said. She said Abe didn't nominate anybody for the Supreme Court before the election because he thought he should wait until after the voters had a say. She made that up out of thin air. In fact, history shows, that the reason he didn't nominate someone right away was because the Senate wasn't in session. The second the Senate came back in session, he nominated Chase. Chase was confirmed to be justice the same day, and that's what happened. So, it was a lot a lie out of Kamala.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: After.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It was the fine people hoax. It was Trump disbanded the pandemic unit out of the NSC.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It was this lie. It was -- she didn't denounce white supremacy, lied about Lincoln. A lot of lies.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Thank you for the -- thank you for the history lesson, Jesse. We appreciate it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're welcome.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Coming up, you won't believe the Democrats' latest attempt to try to take down President Trump. That's next.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.utterance: Nancy Pelosi doubting President Trump's mental fitness after his COVID-19 diagnosis. Now, the speaker is talking about taking drastic measures against him. Watch.

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI (D-CA)
utterances.utterance: I don't know what the prospects are when we hear people saying I'm young and I'm a perfect specimen. Come here tomorrow. We're going to be talking about the 25th Amendment, but not to take attention away from the subject we have now.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Do you think it's time to invoke the 25th Amendment?

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.utterance: I'll talk to you about that tomorrow. I'll talk to you about it tomorrow. I'm not talking about it today because I have to tell you -- if you want to talk about that, we'll see you tomorrow.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The President is firing back tweeting "Crazy Nancy is the one who should be under observation. They don't call her crazy for nothing." Oh, gosh, is this like an episode of Veep or what? I don't even know what to do. She said she doesn't want to talk about it. Then, she teases come back tomorrow to talk about it ensuring that everyone is going to talk about it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who does she remind you of? Donald Trump?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She has learned from the master.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If you want to knock out real news, all you got to do is make up some of your own because she's learned that. Like Trump played CNN like -- just like a violin, right? He just knew that he could just get -- he could just eat up all the time. She's doing that with us. What do we have in this block? Before we had the Russia collusion. It's probably one of the biggest cover ups in the history of cover ups that destroyed so many institutions, undermine the media, undermine the FBI, and we kick it out for this story. It's freaking brilliant what she did. And it's almost -- I mean, it's like, that's what -- you can't blame her. You could almost kind of admire her for it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I think the fact is, what you get here is she gets under Trump's skin like nobody else.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, but she just do what Trump did.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, but I think -- I think she's in some ways genius because she's trolling Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She learned.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think -- I think just like when she said Trump shouldn't --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You guys are great.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- Trump shouldn't have a debate. Biden shouldn't bother to debate Trump because Trump lies so much. I think it just got under Trump's skin. And I think by the way, the substance of it, there's a real possibility that, you know, the drugs and things that Trump is taking because of his illness is impacting and making him -- I mean, why would anybody say no more talks about helping America?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Why do you think -- I mean, it's really anything different.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I mean, that's the thing, Katie. I don't know if I --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Is there a 25th amendment for the Speaker of the House. Is there like something similar that they can invoke to try and make sure that Nancy Pelosi is also in her right mind? The big news tomorrow she wants you to tune in for his they are going to announce the establishment of a Commission on Presidential Capacity because that's exactly what the House should be focusing on right now.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: A commission?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Another commission in Washington D.C. which I'm sure will solve all the problems that she wants --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That is an old trick when you can't get Coronavirus relief bill pass, you start a commission on something.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm sure it will be a lot like the presidential debate commission, very fair and balanced. This is exactly what Greg said. They're trying to take the wind out of Pence's sales because he mopped the floor with Kamala.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, everybody agrees. Kamala lost and you lost hard.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: This is -- this is -- nobody agrees. Are you crazy? No, no.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Why are they keep distracting us with 25th Amendment and changing it to a virtual debate?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Maybe it Trump. Maybe it was Trump who got --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If you had a good debate, you let it (INAUDIBLE) all day on cable. That's the strategy.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: (INAUDIBLE) out of the next debate, Jesse because you saw what happened to Pence last night.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And I also tell you what, they have to -- this took a bite out of the virus in terms of public perception, the fact that the President's recovered and he's ready to get back out there so quickly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes, he looks great.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, they have to say you're crazy, Mr. President, for recovering, for being healthy, and for wanting to get back out on the campaign trail because Coronavirus, that's a death sentence. And the fact that you recovered like that and are telling seniors that Regeneron is on the way, we have to undermine that because you must be crazy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I would agree. He must be crazy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You know the best thing about this hour?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The "FASTEST SEVEN" is up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well done.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. It's time for the "FASTEST SEVEN." First up, last night, you may have heard about this, a fly landed on Mike Pence's head. It had Twitter all worked up. I remember when the same thing happened to Hillary during 2016, those damn flies. You know what I love, Dana? Everybody who wanted a substantive debate on Twitter fixated on the fly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. I mean, it provided a little entertainment and I -- you know, if the Plexiglas hadn't been there, Kamala Harris could have reached over and like, knocked it out of his hair. That would have been a nice gesture, I think. Frank Fahrenkopf of the commission, the Commission on Presidential Debates, he's going to be on Martha McCallum's show tonight. So, you want to see that out on the story. Maybe she'll ask them if they planted the fly.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan, I noticed the fly was not wearing a mask.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know, I like this story because I think it's silly, refreshing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He's just like us.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think -- I think if Mike Pence had swatted it, I think it would -- might have humanized him because otherwise --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't think he knew.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think he -- I don't know if he knew but he just looked like he was kind of not in touch with it. He didn't he doesn't have much presence, let me just say.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, let me explain. If you have a lot of hairspray in your hair, you don't notice when things get stuck in there.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's OK, but I'm saying it would have humanized him if he'd had a human reaction to something.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But he didn't know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But he didn't notice, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, OK. But anyway, I do think it's much better that we're discussing this than last week when we're discussing Trump's bullying performance.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Can we talk about the deep state, please?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Steve Schmidt, Jesse, I think was on MSNBC, claimed it was the mark of the devil.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, he didn't.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, I've seen so many flies land on Barack Obama's head that like I could make a montage out of it. So --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tomorrow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Tomorrow, coming up.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I have some good advice for all future debate prep. Bring insect repellent and spray it on yourself before you go out there, so we don't have this problem. And there is now a Mike Pence bobblehead available with the fly in the hair nice.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Nice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, insects do not maintain social distancing rules and that's wrong. California's governor is asking diners to be extra careful with this tweet he did. "Going out to eat with members of your household this weekend? Don't forget to keep your mask on in between bites." Katie, this is like idiotic, because the rules states that don't touch your mask.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Try not to touch your mask.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: You're going to get your mask full of all kinds of grease and food and disgusting. Just -- if you have to take off your mask in between bites, you're not going to go to a restaurant.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: This is the thing that makes it harder for people to get back into business. Like if I can't go enjoy a meal and have my mask off the entire time, I'm just not going to go. And this is not based on science, it's just based on political theater. So --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Dana, it's extreme non-scientific positions that undermined actual positions. Like, everybody is OK with common sense, but when you go too far, people say that's it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, and it's also -- it's a hope.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And maybe the -- maybe the numbers in my state will go down if I make people wear their mask in between taking a bite. Well, if that's the case, then nobody should be going to any restaurants then.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, why don't you just go ahead and do that if that's what your goal is. I'm very worried about the restaurants in this country. I do think people can take common sense precautions. But if you're going to allow people to go to restaurants, you got to allow them to eat.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm must have said a bad word. I need some sleep.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She's going to say, heck. Jesse, what do you make of this?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know what I do sometimes? If I'm at a restaurant that has this mandate, I'll put the mask on my face. And then I'll pour all the food into the mask, and I'm like a horse, and I'll just eat like that.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: It's gross.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jesse, I think we're in for a mom text.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. We've already had two, Juan.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. It's like a -- it will be like a feedbag, a feedbag.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan, would you eat like that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, but I think the intent is good. I think you have a governor who's trying to do something, you know, positive to try to lower the infection rate, but it's just not realistic. But again, to my mind, this is a reflection, the fact that the governors are out there, they're trying all kinds of ways to deal with this because we have no national plan, no national leader.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, it's unscientific way.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: National bite --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's unscientific.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, Thanksgiving is going to look a bit different this year. Four in 10 people say they are planning to do it virtually. And for those hosting in-person, 30 percent plan on setting up mandatory temperature checks. Juan, how do you pull the wishbone on a virtual Thanksgiving?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I guess you do it virtually.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I mean, this is -- to me, this is pretty sad. I mean, I actually thought there might be a higher number than four out of six. Because you know, when you get together you got young people, then you got older people who clearly are more vulnerable to this disease, so you got to be careful. But boy, you know, it's just sad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's sad because you have grandparents, they want to see their grandkids.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But Katie, it makes feuding in-laws relieved that you don't --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Well, I don't even want to get into the family feuds about wearing masks, not wearing masks, who's in-charge, what's good. That's just a bad idea. But the good news is that they are coming out with rapid tests. So, maybe next --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: And by Christmas time, we'll be able to all take the test and feel more comfortable about having Thanksgiving dinner together.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We're still going to be counting votes in Thanksgiving, Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm going to be yelling at my mom over Zoom about ballot harvesting.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We're going to be having Thanksgiving dinner in the green room.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is so true. I'm scared. I'm worried.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We'll be thinking -- we'll call you mom.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. All right, "ONE MORE THING" up next. How's that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's time now for "ONE MORE THING." I'm going to kick it off. I'm going to tell you, I've got baseballs on my desk, I've got baseballs on my window sills, baseballs, I've caught at games, baseball signed by famous people. So, take a look at this bucket of baseballs and the heartfelt note attached to it. It was written by Randy Long of Alabama. Long who's 72, left that bucket and the note at a local batting cage. He explains in the note that his children and grandchildren are now grown, and he doesn't get to throw the balls around with them anymore. He ended the note with some advice that's just like eternal advice for all dads. He said, you won't believe how quickly the time will pass when you can play ball with the kids. Cherish those moments, give your kids a hug, and tell them you love them every chance you get. Jesse, you're up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Very sweet. Remember the Home Alone iconic scene, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I do.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Listen.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I'm in good shape.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: My kids love that movie. So, Macaulay turn that famous screen into a mask. There he is. He's COVID free with the screen mask, Macaulay Culkin. And look at Macaulay with the mask next to him. Look at that. The kid does not age. He's like Dana. It's like they never get older.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's aged.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He is? You partied with him, haven't you, Gutfeld?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, really?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A long time ago. I won't get into it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You're up, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Will you tell us on the commercial break?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK, I want to talk about the Gary Sinise Foundation. Gary Sinise has expanded the normal veterans outreach that they do to help people during the pandemic. They recently teamed up with local organizations to help provide meals to feed veterans and frontline workers at VAs across the country. They do box meals mostly -- they most recently, excuse me, help feed nearly 3,000 frontline workers and veterans at the New Orleans V.A. So, I think that's amazing, right? Coronavirus has brought a lot of people together. Just last month, they built their 65th home for wounded veterans so they're not stopping on doing that either. So, you can learn more --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He should come on THE FIVE.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- Yes, Greg. I agree. He should comeon THE FIVE. What, are you like -- are you like a booker now?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I'm doing a lot of booking on the side. Times are kind of tied over at the Gutfeld residence.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. That's how you afforded that new car.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. If I ever get that car. All right, where --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You're up. You're up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK. OK, it's time for Greg's How Many Nuts part two. You know the drill. I'm going to go over and ask you guys one question. Katie, how many nuts?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Seven.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Two nuts.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Two nuts?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: One.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: One, OK. You said 10, you said seven. All right, let's see. Roll it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, I forgot what this was about.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: So, did I.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I always say two.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Four, five --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Wow, Juan is going to win.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's just the same --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh my goodness.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: This chipmunk is ready for winter.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Juan nailed it.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Juan was spot on.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What does he win?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan, you win --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait, wait a second. You know how I got --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- a bag of nuts.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- you know how I got this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Why?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because Jesse had the idea in a previous segment. You just put it in the mask and then you --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's a feedbag.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm telling you, man, Jesse is my leader, man.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I like it. All right, so we all know that 2020 has been intense. But if you're looking to getaway, the Web site is offering one lucky person a chance to book a rustic underground cave vacation during the election weeks from November 2nd to November 5th. It's a five-night stay. You can have the chance to stay in this off the grid man cave built 50 feet below the ground in New Mexico. It's a once in a lifetime booking. The booking will go live tomorrow. They're under a rock Web site at Friday, tomorrow, October 9th at 9:00 a.m. Eastern time. There's only one person who's going to be able to book it. So, if you've always wanted to live under a rock like most people, this is your chance, especially during election week.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is perfect for November.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: But they're going to have to extend this to Thanksgiving, right, because we're going to be counting ballots forever.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They're going to come out of the rock and they're going to find out of Joe is going to pack the court.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Biden is actually -- Biden is actually bidding on it right now.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Finally, they'll finally know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, you know, the three of us were in Utah, and guess who we ran into, our friend Jason Chaffetz, the former congressman who represents part -- a little bit of Salt Lake, but then all the way down towards the Great Arches and Zion National Park and Salt Lake. I tell you, it was fun. Did you have fun?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He'll be on "WATTERS' WORLD" this weekend, so tune in 8:00 Eastern.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Way to plug.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I love Utah. I spent a lot of time there when I was a kid. That was a place where we went on a lot of road trips --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: From Wyoming?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. I was -- I was born in Evanston, Wyoming, and then that was just a hop, a skip, and a jump away to Salt Lake City. But I thought Utah hosted us very, very well. It was a pleasure.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It was great. Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And good food.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Thank you, Utah. That's it for us today. "SPECIAL REPORT." Content and Programming Copyright 2020 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
